org.apache.freemarker.spring.model

Class BindDirective

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.apache.freemarker.spring.model.AbstractSpringTemplateCallableModel
      • org.apache.freemarker.spring.model.AbstractSpringTemplateDirectiveModel
        • org.apache.freemarker.spring.model.BindDirective
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    TemplateCallableModel, TemplateDirectiveModel, TemplateModel

    public class BindDirective
extends AbstractSpringTemplateDirectiveModel
    Provides TemplateModel wrapping BindStatus for the given bind path, working similarly to Spring Framework's <spring:bind /> JSP Tag Library.

    This directive supports the following parameters:

    • path: The first positional parameter pointing to the bean or bean property to bind status information for.
    • ignoreNestedPath: A named parameter to set whether to ignore a nested path, if any. false by default.

    Some valid example(s): 

       <@spring.bind "user.email"; status>
     <input type="text" name="email" value="${status.value!}" />
   </@spring.bind>

    Note: Unlike Spring Framework's <spring:bind /> JSP Tag Library, this directive does not support htmlEscape parameter. It always has BindStatus not to escape HTML's because it is much easier to control escaping in FreeMarker Template expressions.

      • isNestedContentSupported

        public boolean isNestedContentSupported()
        Description copied from interface: TemplateDirectiveModel
        Tells if this directive supports having nested content. If false, yet the caller specifies a non-empty nested content (non-0-length, even whitespace matters), FreeMarker will throw a TemplateException with descriptive error message, and TemplateDirectiveModel.execute(TemplateModel[], CallPlace, Writer, Environment) won't be called. If true, the author of the directive shouldn't forget calling CallPlace.executeNestedContent(TemplateModel[], Writer, Environment), unless the intent was to skip the nested content. (This property was added to prevent the frequent oversight (in FreeMarker 2) where a directive that isn't supposed to have nested content doesn't examine if there's a nested content to throw an exception in that case. Then if there's nested content, it will be silently skipped during execution, as the directive never calls CallPlace.executeNestedContent(TemplateModel[], Writer, Environment).)

      • getDirectiveArgumentArrayLayout

        public ArgumentArrayLayout getDirectiveArgumentArrayLayout()
        Description copied from interface: TemplateDirectiveModel
        Returns the argument array layout to use when calling the {@link #execute(TemplateModel[], CallPlace, Writer, Environment)} method, or rarely null. If it's null then there can only be positional arguments, any number of them (though of course the execute method implementation itself may restricts the acceptable argument count), and the argument array will be simply as long as the number of arguments specified at the call place.
